customize.text: Lingyuan's friend, who calls her Bluey.

customize.name: Xuanwen Beast
customize.desc:
Xuanwen Beasts, named for the dark patterns on their bodies, are fierce creatures that inhabit the mountains of Chenyu Vale.
In the region's folklore, these beasts were the servants of an adeptus in ancient times, tasked with vanquishing evil and protecting the region. However, they devolved into brutal creatures after said adeptus passed away. These legends cannot be verified, and no one knows the true identity of this adeptus. This much is for sure, however — one should stay away from these aggressive creatures for one's safety.
For over a thousand years, these beasts have lost a tremendous amount of territory that once belonged to them to relentless human encroachment. These days, they can only occasionally be spotted in the remote mountains of Chenyu Vale...

customize.text: Stop Motion Animation: "Tidings of an Auspicious Beast"

<color=#ffd780>January 20, 2024</color>
Through Wushou Dance shall the propitious legend of the Suanni be told.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>

The Suanni are illuminated beasts from Chenyu Vale. These elegant and proud mystical beasts only live in the mountains, shrouded in Adeptal energy. Since ancient times, they have been considered a symbol of good fortune, and their preference for living aloof from the material world has been admired by intellectuals for generations. These days, the well-known Wushou Dance in Chenyu Vale came from the movements of the Suanni. But since only a handful of people have actually seen such creatures, most can only imagine what they look like. After thousands of years of changes and different artistic interpretations, the Wushou Dance costume head has developed into its current style.

The azure Suanni, Lingyuan, lived in Chenyu Vale back in the days when people did not inhabit the land. When people came to the vale along with their goddess and her two servants, Herblord and Fujin, Fujin defeated the Suanni. Instead of killing her, Fujin and Herblord befriended Lingyuan, who became known to the people as the Mountain Lord. Fujin planted the first tea tree on Lingyuan's mountain, the branches of which people then grafted to the other side of the river. Although Lingyuan was angry at such insolence, she could already imagine the aroma of the tea that she would drink with her friends.
In those distant times, Lingyuan, together with Fujin and Herblord, took on human form. One day, Lingyuan accidentally drank the celebratory libations and hauled forest boars in to ask them "Who's prettier, me or Herblord?" Another time, she ate too many teacakes at the temple fair and came crying to Herblord asking to make her some slimming tea, because she didn't know that a human form created by Adeptal energy can never gain weight. After Herblord left Chenyu Vale and Fujin lost all her powers, Lingyuan decided to never take on human form again.

When the Archon War broke out in Teyvat, and Fujin with Herblord went against their goddess, Lingyuan called upon her familiars, the Xuanwen Beasts, to drive the people into the caves, giving them the opportunity to escape. Although Lingyuan, unlike Fujin and Herblord, never fell in love with people, she wanted to help her friends.

Several thousand years later, the Suanni rescued a boy from Qiaoying Village, Little Mao, and they became friends, although Lingyuan prefers not to admit it. Little Mao was playing in the mountains one time and saw a rabbit that couldn't move because of a rock that was on top of it. He removed that rock and gave it some fruits, although the rabbit did not eat, but only nodded at him before hopping into the forest. It rained heavily later on that day, and Little Mao couldn't find his way home, so he hid under a big rock, where Lingyuan found him. In response to the boy's kindness to the rabbit, the Suanni brought him fruits and guided him out of the mountains. Later, she allowed Mao to call herself Bluey, and began to show him different places, treat him to fruits and tell him stories of the past. If Mao lost something, she asked the birds to help him, and they found the lost things in the forest. Although the mountains of the valley are dangerous, she always protects the boy.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Chenyu Vale
customize.desc:
The gentle breezes carry the fragrance of tea all across the mountains of Liyue, filling the air with the savory scent once more.

"Tea grows upon the rocks, where jade springs endlessly flow." The faint perfume and ancient song of jade drift together along the rivers past Qiaoying Village to the bustling port of Yilong Wharf. Just what adventures and fortune await, concealed among the fog-robed peaks of the south...?

customize.name: Adepti
customize.desc: Adepti are a group of immortal illuminated beasts of Liyue, who have protected people for millennia.

customize.desc:
Xuanwen Beasts, named for the dark patterns on their bodies, are fierce creatures that inhabit the mountains of Chenyu Vale.
In the region's folklore, these beasts were the servants of an adeptus in ancient times, tasked with vanquishing evil and protecting the region. However, they devolved into brutal creatures after said adeptus passed away. These legends cannot be verified, and no one knows the true identity of this adeptus. This much is for sure, however — one should stay away from these aggressive creatures for one's safety.

customize.text: Thousands of years later, the Mountain Lord decided to return Chenyu lands to their state before the arrival of people. She believed that she, and the carps, and the snakes all came from nature, so she wanted to return everything to the form that was at their birth. Then the rivers rose and fell with the rains, their paths were not fixed, the tea trees and flowers were not trimmed or cultivated, nor did they exist for humanity. Lingyuan believed that in such an environment, Fujin would regain her true carp form and spiritual strength and frolic in the great rivers. For many years, the Suanni was changing the spirit veins, due to which the soil deteriorated, a thick fog arose, and miasma spread through the vale.

Fujin, who cares about the people of the vale, asked for the help of the Traveler to restore the spirit veins and change the soil. The Adeptus did not have enough strength to perform the Rainjade Rite herself, so she needed help. She didn't want Qiaoying Village, famous for its tea, to lose its reason for existence. Thanks to Traveler, Paimon and Lingyuan's friend, Little Mao, Fujin was able to gain enough strength to perform a ritual on the sacred mountain and stop Lingyuan. The Suanni accepted defeat and, for the sake of her friend, agreed not to interfere with caring for people.
